text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Apple IIGS is the fifth model in the Apple ][ line of computers. It was marketed from 1986 to 1993. The "GS" stands for Graphics and Sound, referencing its advanced multimedia capabilities. Compared to the ][, the IIGS used a 16-bit CPU, a Ensoniq ES5503 sound chip supporting 32 channels, up to 8MB of RAM and was capable of a resolution up to 640x200 in 4 colors and 320×200 in 16. Being mostly backwards compatible with Apple ][ software, the IIGS is often considered the superior platform to play Apple ][ games on.
